description:
Corporate Engineering is an extremely diverse organization responsible for inventing, building, implementing and supporting all of Google’s internal tools and systems. In Corporate Engineering, our mission is to build innovative products that inspire and enable Googlers to be successful every day. As the company grows in scale and complexity, we ensure we remain true to our innovation-centered culture.

One of our biggest challenges as a company is to ensure that the policies, procedures and platforms continue to scale. People Operations is at the heart of this evolution and has long led many innovations in HR, including a data based approach to people management. There is a significant opportunity to apply the very best of Google’s core assets such as machine learning, knowledge graph, data analytics to ensure that People Operations realizes their vision to be leaders in all aspects of HR, Talent Management, Diversity and Inclusion and Operational Excellence.

You have a deep appreciation for how technology is fundamentally changing the way we work and how our platforms need to change to meet the needs of future generations of Googlers. This means understanding how AI will reinvent talent management, how “Internet of Things” will drive employee well being, how social apps will change how we think about development feedback and how micro-learning technology will be at the heart of continuous learning.

We put Googlers’ interests at the center of everything we do, have a bias towards action, product excellence and creating and open and respectful culture where everyone can continue to grow and learn.

Google Cloud helps millions of employees and organizations empower their employees, serve their customers, and build what’s next for their business — all with technology built in the cloud. Our products are engineered for security, reliability and scalability, running the full stack from infrastructure to applications to devices and hardware. And our teams are dedicated to helping our customers — developers, small and large businesses, educational institutions and government agencies — see the benefits of our technology come to life.
eeo: At Google, we don’t just accept difference—we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our products and our community. Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing this form.
qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, similar technical field or equivalent practical experience.
  • 15 years of experience engineering in HCM (Human Capital Management).
  • 15 years of experience building out HR systems, web applications, mobile applications, data warehouses and automating processes.

Preferred qualifications:

  • 15 years experience in machine learning and computer vision-based solutions.
  • Experience in leading large software engineering/product development organizations on mobile, web, cloud with a solid track record of launches/landings.
  • Track record of growing and building highly effective teams, working with stakeholders and collaborating across organizational boundaries.
  • Ability to communicate clearly and persuasively, creating commitment and a drive for success within the teams.
responsibilities:
• Lead complex, multi-disciplinary engineering projects and initiatives that require coordination across Google.
  • Bring together the technologies in Technical Infrastructure/Cloud, Corporate Engineering and other product areas.
  • Manage strategies to align with the most critical projects, ensuring our people are working on the most rewarding initiatives.
title: VP, Google Corporate Engineering
